hero.name: Vince Linise
hero.description: I'm currently in my second year of a Bachelor's in Multimedia and Internet (BUT MMI) at IUT de Lannion (in Brittany, France) and I develop Web and mobile applications in parallel. I also do interface design and motion design.

composeTonLogo.name: Compose ton Logo
composeTonLogo.title: Interactive device for open house day

lePhare.name: Le Phare aux Spectacles
lePhare.title: UI/UX design for a shows application

aboutMe.description1: My name is Vince Linise and I'm 18 years old. To keep it short, my journey began the day I received my first computer.
aboutMe.description1b: What was just a gift became a revelation: I love everything this tool allows me to explore, create and experience, and I want to make it my career. That's why I chose to study BUT MMI at IUT de Lannion.
aboutMe.picture1: That's me! During the filming of the latest Papillon Event, an annual video webinar presenting my application's new features
aboutMe.description2: Passionate about open-source, I dedicate a large part of my energy to the Papillon association. As president and developer, I've been leading a mobile application for 4 years that now accompanies thousands of students in their daily lives.
aboutMe.description2b: On the technical side, I juggle between React, JavaScript, Figma and double espressos (with one sugar, preferably) to design memorable and pleasant web and mobile experiences.
aboutMe.picture2: Okay, it's clearly staged, but it illustrates pretty well when I was working on Papillon v8 during the summer of 2025

map.title: Kenavo!
map.description: To be honest, I don't speak a word of Breton, and I was told it doesn't mean "Hello" but "goodbye" (and that's a shame, because it would be nice to see each other again on my LinkedIn).
map.description2: Anyway, I'm Breton and I've lived here since birth!
map.picture: That's quite a journey every weekend!

iutLannion.title: Multimedia and Internet
iutLannion.subtitle: Bachelor of Technology
iutLannion.specificity: specialty Web Development and interactive devices
iutLannion.description: A super-versatile training where I learn to manage multimedia projects from A to Z, from technical integration to digital marketing, with the goal of getting my degree in 2027.

lycee.title: General Baccalaureate
lycee.subtitle: Secondary education
lycee.description: Obtained the general baccalaureate at high school with specialties in Digital & Computer Science, Contemporary World English, and Economics and Social Sciences (which I followed in English).

linagora.title: Front-end developer apprentice
linagora.description: Front-end developer apprentice on the Twake Workplace solution, a sovereign and open-source alternative to collaborative work environments. I mainly contribute to the development of the user interface in React.

papillon.title: President
papillon.description: Papillon is now France's most downloaded open-source school life application. It allows more than 1,500,000 students to access their data through a modern, intuitive and fully customizable interface. As president and developer, I placed the user experience at the heart of this project to offer students a tool built by them and for them.

strella.title: Developer and UX designer
strella.description: Developer and UI/UX designer for StrellaStudio association clients, which provides digital services to companies looking to develop on the Web.

cozy.title: Front-end developer
cozy.description: Development and planning of a front-end and back-end client for aggregating school data for secondary students on the Cozy Cloud connector platform for deployment to academies.

papillonSection.title: "One day, I will spread my wings"...
papillonSection.subtitle: ...or something like that, I don't remember
papillonSection.description: Papillon is my biggest project ever. In short, it's an app where students can find everything they need to study well — and today, more than 1,500,000 of them have tried it!
papillonSection.picture: Here's the team I work with on Papillon! (yes, we only have one photo together)

leadership.title: Leadership and Initiative
leadership.description: As president of Papillon, I learned to manage a team and combine different skills to successfully carry out a project over time.

autonomy.title: Autonomy and Curiosity
autonomy.description: Passionate, I'm continually interested in and train myself on the latest technologies. I seek to understand how things work and how to improve them.

empathy.title: User Empathy
empathy.description: My design approach is human-centered. I primarily seek to solve identifiable problems with a solution that provides a pleasant and intuitive experience.

adaptation.title: Adaptability
adaptation.description: Juggling between code and design, or adapting to new work environments is natural for me. I pivot quickly according to challenges, projects and teams.
